overview: From 2025-06-02 to 2025-06-03, elizaos/eliza had 10 new PRs (10 merged), 3 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topIssues.title: I can't get my bot to detect my twitter activity
topIssues.author: FancyFishok
topIssues.body:
I got my bot to log in and make a post using the client on local host, but I can't get it to respond to other tweets using “TWITTER_TARGET” nor does it respond when I mention it with another account

I have already checked that my Cookies are ok and I've successfully installed the plugins

I also tried using Twitter-client in the plugins seccion

I am using the main version

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a82cafe-1acb-4f26-8991-aa67ec3d1dca)

topIssues.title: New plugin created from elizaos create -t plugin: remove requirements for Telegram, Discord configs
topIssues.author: techcomthanh
topIssues.body:
The newly created plugin, somehow when starting in /dev mode, it requires configurations for Telegram & Discords, even though I have never installed these plugins or asked the Agent to include them.

To reproduce:
elizaos create -t plugin name
cd plugin-name
elizaos dev (or start)

[2025-06-01 16:45:07] ERROR: Error details: Telegram configuration validation failed:
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN: Telegram bot token is required
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] ERROR: Stack trace: Error: Telegram configuration validation failed:
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN: Telegram bot token is required
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] WARN: Discord API Token not provided - Discord plugin is loaded but will not be functional
[2025-06-01 16:45:07] WARN: To enable Discord functionality, please provide DISCORD_API_TOKEN in your .eliza/.env file

Then process halted!

topIssues.title: Quickstart doc issues
topIssues.author: eduardoPauloPanstein
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

https://eliza.how/docs/quickstart -> Install Globally (Recommended)

There are two main issues affecting the onboarding and first interaction with ElizaOS:

1. **Missing prerequisites in documentation:**  
   The Quickstart guide does not mention that [Bun](https://bun.sh/) is required for plugin installation, nor does it mention that some essential plugins (such as `@elizaos/plugin-sql`) may need to be installed manually if the automatic installation fails. This leads to startup errors for new users.

2. **Error when interacting with the agent:**  
   After installing Bun and the required plugins, the dashboard loads, but when trying to interact with the agent, an error occurs:  
   `Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING`

---

**To Reproduce**

1. Follow the Quickstart guide:  
   - Install ElizaOS CLI with `npm install -g @elizaos/cli@beta`
   - Run `elizaos start`
3. Select your database: › pglite (embedded database)
3. Observe errors about missing plugins (e.g., `@elizaos/plugin-sql`) and failed automatic installation.
4. Manually install missing plugins and Bun as a workaround.
5. Start ElizaOS again, open the dashboard at `http://localhost:3000`.
6. Try to interact with the agent.
7. Observe the error:  
   `Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING`

---

**Expected behavior**

- The Quickstart guide should mention all prerequisites, including Bun, and provide troubleshooting steps for missing plugins.
- After installing all dependencies, the agent should be able to process messages without errors related to missing embedding handlers.

---

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/41ef3836-cbd9-44f2-ba3d-4ba8abff16cd)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f109cdd5-cb8a-4f65-9e96-1fdd51baedc0)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/765272e1-43ea-4c7b-a3fa-3c18eb2821cb)

---

**Additional context**

- OS: Ubuntu (running in a Virtual Machine)
- Node.js version: v23.11.0
- ElizaOS CLI version: 1.0.0-beta.34
- Bun version: (after manual install)
- The error log for the TEXT_EMBEDDING issue is attached below: ERROR: Failed to generate embedding:
message: "(Error) No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING"
stack: [
"Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING",
...
]
...
Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING
at AgentRuntime.useModel ...

---

**Suggestions**

- Update the Quickstart documentation to mention Bun as a prerequisite and provide instructions for manual plugin installation if needed.
- Please investigate the TEXT_EMBEDDING error, as it blocks any interaction with the agent after a successful setup.

topPRs.title: feat: refactor message server to be completely separate and standalone from agents
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR updates the message server to use standalone and switches the core to use specs

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Introduced a centralized messaging system with support for servers, channels (including group and DM), participants, and messages, enabling real-time chat and group conversations.
Added UI components for group channels, agent cards, group cards, and a group creation page.
Implemented file and media attachment support in chat and group conversations.
Enhanced sidebar and home page to display central servers and group channels.
Added offline status detection and improved connection handling.
Improvements

Refactored chat and group chat components to use centralized channels and messages.
Upgraded API client and hooks for new messaging, agent, and group management endpoints.
Improved optimistic UI updates and error handling for message sending and file uploads.
Enhanced agent and group navigation with direct message and group chat flows.
Bug Fixes

Improved error handling and logging for network and API failures.
Fixed message deduplication and sorting in chat views.
Documentation

Added detailed documentation for versioned plugin APIs and migration guides.
Tests

Added comprehensive unit and integration tests for new messaging, state conversion, provider compatibility, and search utilities.
Chores

Updated dependencies and improved internal type safety and code organization.

topPRs.title: attempts to fix messaging stuff + ui changes
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added support for navigating and managing multiple direct message (DM) channels per agent, including URL-based DM channel selection.
  - Introduced backend integration for DM channel and related group channel management, enabling real-time creation and deletion.
  - Enhanced chat routing to support URLs with both agent and room identifiers.

- **UI Improvements**
  - Redesigned agent, group, and add-agent cards for a more modern, visually engaging interface.
  - Updated the home page with a dashboard layout, improved loading/empty states, and clear agent/group sections.
  - Enhanced group panel with new icons, visual feedback, and a preview section for group creation/editing.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved toast notifications and error handling for DM and group channel actions.

- **Style**
  - Applied extensive formatting and styling refinements across components for consistency and readability.
  - Added new CSS utilities and animations for richer visual effects.

- **Chores**
  - Removed unused imports and cleaned up code for better maintainability.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: replace PGLite message bus with fast in-memory implementation
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker

topPRs.title: feat: switch to postgres-js
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
# PR Description: Switch to postgres-js for improved Supabase compatibility

## Summary
Migrated database connection from node-postgres to postgres-js to resolve compatibility issues users were experiencing with Supabase deployments.

## Changes Made
- Switched from `drizzle-orm/node-postgres` to `drizzle-orm/postgres-js`
- Updated import statements to use `postgres` from 'postgres' package instead of node-postgres Pool
- Added `prepare: false` configuration to disable prepared statements for Supabase transaction pooling mode
- Updated dependency requirements in package.json

## Why This Change
- Supabase's transaction pooling mode doesn't support prepared statements, which was causing connection issues for users
- postgres-js uses prepared statements by default, but allows easy opt-out for environments like Supabase
- postgres-js is the recommended driver for Supabase integration with Drizzle ORM

## Benefits
- Eliminates connection errors when using Supabase's connection pooler
- Better compatibility with Supabase's transaction mode pooling
- Maintains all existing functionality while improving reliability
- Follows Supabase + Drizzle best practices from official documentation

## Testing
- [ ] Verified connection works with Supabase transaction pooling
- [ ] Confirmed existing queries continue to function
- [ ] Tested with both direct connections and pooled connections

This change should resolve the Supabase connection issues users have been experiencing while maintaining backward compatibility with existing implementations.
